summary:
• The Taliban wishes Americans would come to Afghanistan.
• The Afghan War Commission has begun investigating the country's longest conflict.
• The commission aims to uncover the truth behind the ongoing conflict in Afghanistan.

• A Bangladesh court has scrapped job quotas to address grievances from the people.
• The death toll in the ongoing protests has exceeded 100, with Dhaka being placed under a curfew.
• The government has imposed a curfew to contain the spread of violence in response to the anti-government protests that have resulted in numerous deaths.

• A new record-breaking rowing boat will transport the Olympic torch across the world.
• This massive vessel is designed specifically for this historic journey.
• The exact route remains undisclosed due to security concerns.

• A devastating boat fire claimed the lives of at least 40 Haitian migrants.
• The tragedy highlights the dangers faced by those attempting to flee Haiti's troubled past and uncertain future.
• This incident underscores the urgent need for safe and legal migration routes for Haitians seeking better opportunities abroad.

• India's job market struggles persist despite PM Modi's new budget.
• The budget aims to address unemployment through various initiatives.
• However, its effectiveness remains uncertain due to ongoing economic challenges.

• Netanyahu visits Washington as Biden exits US presidential race.
• A long-hidden painting is uncovered after its frame is turned over.
• The Gaza conflict appears to be subsiding, but civilian casualties continue to mount.

• The Malaysian government has tracked down a missing oil tanker that fled the scene after colliding with another vessel.
• Authorities have successfully located the fugitive tanker.
• This incident highlights the importance of maritime safety regulations in preventing such incidents from occurring.

• Bodies of frozen climbers have been recovered from the "death zone" on Mount Everest.
• The recovery operation was carried out by a team led by a Nepalese mountaineer.
• The incident highlights the risks faced by climbers attempting to reach the summit of the world's highest mountain.

• A new oil refinery is being built in Nigeria to increase oil production.
• The project aims to boost economic growth by creating jobs and generating revenue.
• Its successful completion will reduce reliance on imported fuel and enhance energy security.

• The Spanish government is implementing measures to mitigate the negative impacts of over-tourism.
• Local communities are pushing back against unchecked tourist development and exploitation.
• The industry must adopt sustainable practices to preserve cultural heritage and protect the environment.

• Devastating warfare in Sudan is forcing people to make desperate choices.
• The conflict has resulted in severe human rights abuses.
• Many civilians have been forced to flee their homes due to the violence.

• President warns against protests in Uganda
• Protests in Uganda face opposition from authorities

• People in the city demand that Russia defeats Ukraine and the West at any cost.
• The locals believe Russia's victory is crucial for their own security and prosperity.
• They see Western intervention as a threat to their nation's sovereignty and independence.

• Kamala Harris is now considered a leading candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination after Biden dropped out.
• The withdrawal of Biden leaves the Democrats facing challenges, while Trump can continue his campaign with renewed energy.
• Several people have been mentioned as potential challengers for the presidency or running mates for Harris.

• The article discusses how to run against an autocratic president in Venezuela's upcoming presidential election.
• It highlights the challenges faced by opposition candidates, including limited access to media and resources.
• The article suggests that building strong relationships with international organizations can be crucial in gaining support and recognition.

• The passing of President Nguyen Phu Trong has sent shockwaves throughout Vietnam, leaving many wondering about the implications for the country's political landscape.
• As the longest-serving general secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam, Trong was instrumental in shaping the nation's economic policies and strategic relationships with regional powers.
• With his departure, Vietnam faces a crucial period of transition, marked by uncertainty over who will succeed him and how they will navigate the complex web of internal politics and international relations.

• Israel intercepted a missile launched by Yemen's Houthis.
• Houthis claimed responsibility for a drone strike targeting an Israeli ship at the port city of Eilat.
• The Houthis also attacked a U.S. Embassy branch in Tel Aviv using drones.
